name: Duang Jai Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I have just returned from Krabi and we have stayed at the Duangjai resort.
reviews.title: Love the settings of the Hotel

likes.liked: — Nice Resort Settings and cleaniness of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Wonderful Place!
3 Star Boutique Hotel - What a GEM!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Would have been a great hotel if situated in a better location. Satisfied with size of rooms, decoration, layout of hotel. The hotel itself has a relaxing atmosphere with cute decor. Breakfast was pretty good for a hotel of that size as well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but location is a bit of a problem...

likes.liked: — Decor and lay out of the hotel featured small balcony
likes.disliked: — Location far from the street on a lonely soi, tuk tuk only way out

reviews.text: Major problems with location because you will need to call a tuk-tuk taxi to go anywhere, or else is a long walk. Once we had the reception call a taxi, which did not show (waited for about 30 minutes). Luckily another tuk tuk was sending some people to the hotel so we got on that one. A tuk tuk will set you off 50 baht a person, while not a lot, its a bit annoying when you are paying for 3 or 4 rides a day.
reviews.title: Nice and small hotel

likes.liked: — That this hotel is so small and nice

reviews.text: Some may opt to walk, which would probably be fine during the day but at night it's a bit of a lonely (dangerous?) walk as the street only has construction sites at the moment.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel, good value

likes.disliked: — The construction along the road to it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd suggest to stay at other hotels in Ao Nang that are nearer to the main street, you get about the same quality and price but the convenience of being a hop and a skip from convenience stores, restaurants and other amenities.
reviews.title: Cozy place and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 weeks at this hotel and we liked it a lot.Clean,big and nice rooms.The staff was nice and frienly,the hotel manager was a little bit strange.Some mornings she said Good morning and some she was in a bad moon and didn´t say anything to us.She was very unfrienly to the rest of the staff, I feel sorry for them that they have a boss like her.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

likes.disliked: — I can't think of anything negative!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went in July as part of our honey moon. The hospitality at Duang-Jai is really top notch. The manager, Jeab, especiallymade us feel very well cared for. She seemed to consider service to the guests a personal responsibility. She is in the hotel around the clock almost every day of the week, so, even when one of the less experienced staff members makes a mistake, she is there to provide a personal apology and to correct the mistake. For travelers like us who don't like crowds or formality, but who like to be pampered, Duang Jai was the perfect place. Jeab arranged for the two of us to receive Thai massages from two very skilled massage therapists in our room 4 nights in a row. That was really heavenly. We had one of the top floor rooms. The best thing about these rooms is that they are very spacious and have different areas. It was one of the few hotels we stayed in in Thailand that didn't make us feel claustrophobic. The room was set up like a suite, which was nice. There was a semi-kitchen with a dish-rack, dishes, and large sink. It made it easy for us to have meals in the room. We had a large balconey. And there was also a large shower. They charged a fair price for water and beers in our refrigerator. Even though it is not on the most popular part of Krabi beach, we did not find it a problem because we rented a motorbike which was very fun to ride around. My husband and I both agree that we would definitely like to go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Duang Jai is a great low-keyed place to vacation

reviews.text: Very comfortable guesthouse with a great swimming pool. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast rather poor and location a little dark at night.
reviews.title: Very good find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend Duang Jai Resort to people who like to stay in a resort where you want to have privacy and quiet getaways as there are only 20 rooms.We stay there for 5 days and 4 nights. First of all,when we reached the airport, we had a very friendly guy that drove to our resort. The receptionist was very friendly,recommended to us where are the places we should visit. And every morning,the staffs will greet us and asked how was our sleep last night. The resort is quite a new resort, where the room was beautiful, exactly the same as we seen on the website. It has all the facilities that needed, such as kettle, safe box,fridge, hot shower etc. I also particularly like the thick quilt blanket as it is very comfortable to cover with at night. The pool though is not very big, but it's beautiful and there's a jacuzzi too. From the resort to the main road, it's only 5-10 minutes walk, and there are lightings along the way in to the resort at night. So it's quite safe, it's good to have a short walk after a meal. So it's a great place to stay in, we would definitely go back there the next time. (you can take a look at the photos of the resort)
reviews.title: Great place Worth Staying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this little gem for our 5 night stay. I did a lot of research on hotels for our trip to Krabi, and this place looked the best value, and it was. A lovely, small boutique hotel in a nice, quiet location at a great price (especially during low season).
reviews.title: Great value find in Krabi

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms and lovely garden and pool

reviews.text: Great friendly service - we organised a few tours, massages and transfers through reception and they were helpful, and provided good value.
reviews.title: Small and cosy establishment

likes.liked: — The location which was far from the crowd and the interior deco of the room
likes.disliked: — Receptionist telling us that all the rooms are occupied when we requested for late check-out but said she could hold the room for us if we should pay 600 baht for late check-out, which we did since there was no common shower facilities within the resort.

description: Duang Jai Resort in Krabi, Thailand. Reserve exclusive Krabi accommodation at our Ao Nang beach resort and get instant confirmation online.
